title: There is also a mid-seventeenth-century image of Elizabeth I flanked by Cecil and Walsingham on the frontispiece of The Compleat Ambassador, containing the letters of the two pictured, amongst others, by Dudley Digges. Elizabeth, however, is not “in counsel” with the men pictured, and the book is about the counsel that goes on around her and about her, rather than any she herself is involved in
